str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pro and kopto; to drive forward, i.e. to advance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An instrument; plur: arms, weapons. Probably from a primary hepo; an implement or utensil or tool.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
